intro: Campanula fulgens, commonly known as the showy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and bell-shaped, with five lobes that open to reveal prominent stamens and a single pistil. Campanula fulgens thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
